replies.msg: I remember seeing a baseball match at Tokyo Dome Stadium ğŸŸ where I placed a bet on the outcome of the match. I bet heavily on Osaka team. It was unforgettable. Though baseball âš¾ï¸ isn’t very popular in Hong Kong it’s being offset by an increase in the promotion and marketing of the sport. There’s an elegant cafe nearby of which the interior and the exterior are exquisitely and artistically designed. I enjoy drinking coffee â˜•ï¸ and relaxing there so much that I make it worth the barista’s while every time. Last week I had lunch at my Japanese friend Keita’s home ğŸ¡ We washed a box of salad and left it to dry out before consuming it. In this way, there’re more nutrients. After lunch, I told Keita “I’ll wash ğŸ§¼ you dry” He came to the kitchen and stood beside me, drying the cutlery and utensils while I washed. After that, I I gave his sister a foot massage then dried her feet on a towel and a quilt. Since it’s best to dry your clothes out the night before by hanging them on the clothesline, I went ahead and did that. I also bought a pair of trainers ğŸ‘Ÿ for Keita’s sis who said she’d pay me back if I got her those sneakers ğŸ‘Ÿ looks like she sold me a bill of goods. In addition, I bought a Chanel belt but I’m wondering if this really is authentic. I might have been sold a pup. Keita is a manager at Hilton. I admire Keita’s ambition and dogged determination to succeed. He never gets sidetracked from his work by unimportant issues. His brother has opened a clothes store. Hopefully it attracts lots of customers since he bet the farm on it. His uncle was broke several years ago because he bet the ranch on his company that went bankrupt later. That’s the way the rookie crumbles. Anyway, if you’re traveling to Tokyo remember to share loads of photos. I think it’s time to get my beauty sleep ğŸ› My girlfriend has already tumbled down into her warm duvet and got her beauty sleep ğŸ˜´
